variant.question: A force is applied to an object. When the force is removed, the object returns to its original form. This phenomenon is called...

options.text: elastic deformation.
plastic deformation.
strain.
corrosion.

variant.question: Trailing edge flaps on large transport aircraft are normally powered

options.text: hydraulically with electrical back-up.
electrically with hydraulic back-up.
manually with electrical back-up.
pneumatically with hydraulic back-up.

variant.question: Most transport aeroplanes are provided with protection against control jamming. This means that:

options.text: the flight control system has provisions to disconnect the part of the control system that becomes blocked.
in case of seizure, engine control is taken over automatically by an alternate electric circuit.
the aeroplane is protected against the adverse effects of strong electromagnetic radiation.
seized brakes can be released from the cockpit.

variant.question:
A large transport aircraft experiences an unusual attitude situation and successfully recovers from a stall.  
  Which of the following automatic aircraft response may the pilot encounter?

options.text: The auto-slat system may extend the slats fully (part of) automatically through a high angle of attack reading received by the stall warning system.
Automatic deactivation of the autopilot for the remainder of the flight, forcing at least one crew member to monitor the flight path at all times.
Inhibited master warning and caution alerts to reduce distraction to the flight crew during stall recovery.
The auto-thrust may disengage and command idle power preventing excessive pitch-up moments found during a high power setting.

variant.question: On most high by-pass ratio (fan) engines, reverse thrust is achieved by reversing

options.text: only the direction of the fan airflow.
the direction of both the exhaust gas flow (hot stream) and the fan airflow (cold stream).
the direction of rotation of the fan.
only the direction of the exhaust gas flow.

variant.question: For a turbo fan engine, the by-pass ratio is the:

options.text: external airflow mass divided by the internal airflow mass.
internal airflow mass divided by the external airflow mass.
internal airflow mass divided by the fuel flow mass.
fuel flow mass divided by the internal airflow mass.

variant.question: A reverse thrust door warning light on the flight deck instrument panel illuminates when:

options.text: the reverser doors are unlocked.
reverse has been selected but the doors have remained locked.
the reverser doors are locked.
the reverser doors have moved to the reverse thrust position.

variant.question: In a high bypass engine exhaust, the cold flow is usually exhausted:

options.text: separately.
through the air conditioning system.
into the LP compressor inlet.
with the hot gas flow and flows through a mixer unit.

variant.question: The thrust reversers of jet engines may use clamshell doors in order to:

options.text: change the direction of the exhaust gas stream.
stop the flow of the exhaust gas stream.
absorb any surge in engine thrust.
reduce the pressure of the exhaust gas stream by diffusing it to atmosphere.

variant.question:
A reverse thrust alert on the flight deck occurs when:
1) the reverser doors are unlocked with the reverse lever in the stowed position.
2) the reverser doors are locked with the reverse lever in the stowed position.
3) the reverser doors remain stowed with the reverse lever in the deployed position.
4) the reverser doors have moved to the reverse thrust position with the reverse lever in the deployed position.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:
To achieve reverse thrust on a turbine engine with a high by-pass ratio, generally:

options.text: the fan flow is deflected.
the direction of rotation of the fan is reversed.
the fan is stopped.
the flow of hot stream air is reversed.
